title: SpotTarget: Rethinking the Effect of Target Edges for Link Prediction in Graph Neural Networks

methods.name: SpotTarget
methods.description: Excludes target edges connected to low-degree nodes during training to improve link prediction.

limitations: Different split of USAir than theirs because there is no public splits for USAir.
summary: SpotTarget introduces a novel link prediction method that rethinks the effect of target edges in graph neural networks. The method focuses on the impact of excluding training target edges during training. Evaluation on datasets like Ogbl-Collab and Ogbl-Citation2 shows that low-degree nodes experience higher relative degree changes when target edges are excluded. The approach achieves competitive performance in link prediction tasks while addressing data leakage concerns.

title.snippet: SpotTarget: Rethinking the Effect of Target Edges for Link Prediction in Graph Neural Networks

methods.snippet: SpotTarget: Rethinking the Effect of Target Edges for Link Prediction in Graph Neural Networks

limitations.snippet: dimension of hidden layers is is 256, 256 and 32 for ogbl-collab, ogbl-citation2, and USAir respectively. Note that our result on FakeEdge is a bit lower than what they report because (1) we use a different split of USAir than theirs because there is no public splits for USAir.
